title: Foreword and Introduction
description: Foreword and Introduction to Apocalypse of St. John (Single take raw reading)

transcript_parts.text: the apocalypse of saint john by emma
bach
forward this book is an attempt to point
to sources of inward security and
strength
amidst the perplexities of our time if
witnesses to the conviction that the
destinies of the present age are charged
with deeper and far more reaching
significance than calmer and more
settled periods of the past the human
mind comes up against a special barrier
when it endeavors to comprehend the
events of the immediate present
we require some distance from the events
in order to understand them
we are unable to fully grasp the
historic significance of present facts
and the historic facts which we do seem
to grasp belong to the past
and are no longer accessible to our
immediate experience
thus our understanding always lags
behind the actual event
this is this is inevitable because
dakota rudolph steiner
real history is made in the sphere of
the super sensible
high above our heads above the plane of
external events
above the tumult of battles history is
made in the realm of spirit
earthly history is but a shadow of this
meta history
if we were able to watch the events on

we could read this significance at every
single moment of the events in which we
are involved on earth

time
makes visible not only the external but
the inward and hidden continents
of the historic period
for our present age constant reference
to the supersensible events is
particularly indispensable

only the spell of materialism as yet

in reality human actions themselves even

are today a constant opening of the slu

often

the latter half of the lectures was
often given

its literature was confiscated and

i asked myself whether they were still
